verses.kjv: And Saul was consenting unto his death. And at that time there was a great persecution against the church which was at Jerusalem; and they were all scattered abroad throughout the regions of Judaea and Samaria, except the apostles.
verses.ct: Saul fully approved of Stephen's execution. Starting that day, a severe persecution broke out against the church in Jerusalem, and all the believers except the apostles were scattered across the regions of Judea and Samaria.

verses.kjv: And devout men carried Stephen to his burial, and made great lamentation over him.
verses.ct: Some deeply devoted men buried Stephen and mourned intensely for him.

verses.kjv: As for Saul, he made havock of the church, entering into every house, and haling men and women committed them to prison.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Saul was trying to destroy the church. He went from house to house, dragging off both men and women and throwing them in prison.

verses.kjv: Therefore they that were scattered abroad went every where preaching the word.
verses.ct: So the believers who had been scattered went everywhere spreading the message.

verses.kjv: Then Philip went down to the city of Samaria, and preached Christ unto them.
verses.ct: Philip traveled down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed Christ to the people there.

verses.kjv: And the people with one accord gave heed unto those things which Philip spake, hearing and seeing the miracles which he did.
verses.ct: The crowds paid close attention to everything Philip said, as they listened to him and watched the miraculous signs he performed.

verses.kjv: For unclean spirits, crying with loud voice, came out of many that were possessed with them: and many taken with palsies, and that were lame, were healed.
verses.ct: Evil spirits came screaming out of many people who were possessed, and many who were paralyzed or unable to walk were healed.

verses.kjv: And there was great joy in that city.
verses.ct: The whole city was filled with tremendous joy.

verses.kjv: But there was a certain man, called Simon, which beforetime in the same city used sorcery, and bewitched the people of Samaria, giving out that himself was some great one:
verses.ct: Now a man named Simon had been practicing sorcery in that city for some time, amazing the people of Samaria and claiming to be someone great.

verses.kjv: To whom they all gave heed, from the least to the greatest, saying, This man is the great power of God.
verses.ct: Everyone followed him, from the least important to the most powerful, saying, "This man is the Great Power of God."

verses.kjv: And to him they had regard, because that of long time he had bewitched them with sorceries.
verses.ct: They had been devoted to him because he had dazzled them with his magic for a long time.

verses.kjv: But when they believed Philip preaching the things concerning the kingdom of God, and the name of Jesus Christ, they were baptized, both men and women.
verses.ct: But when they believed Philip's message about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ, both men and women were baptized.

verses.kjv: Then Simon himself believed also: and when he was baptized, he continued with Philip, and wondered, beholding the miracles and signs which were done.
verses.ct: Even Simon himself became a believer and was baptized. He stayed close to Philip and was astonished as he watched the great signs and miracles taking place.

verses.kjv: Now when the apostles which were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent unto them Peter and John:
verses.ct: When the apostles in Jerusalem learned that the people of Samaria had accepted God's message, they sent Peter and John to them.

verses.kjv: Who, when they were come down, prayed for them, that they might receive the Holy Ghost:
verses.ct: When they arrived, they prayed for the new believers to receive the Holy Spirit,

verses.kjv: (For as yet he was fallen upon none of them: only they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.)
verses.ct: because the Holy Spirit had not yet come upon any of them — they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.

verses.kjv: Then laid they their hands on them, and they received the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: Then Peter and John placed their hands on them, and they received the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: And when Simon saw that through laying on of the apostles’ hands the Holy Ghost was given, he offered them money,
verses.ct: When Simon saw that the Holy Spirit was given through the apostles placing their hands on people, he offered them money.

verses.kjv: Saying, Give me also this power, that on whomsoever I lay hands, he may receive the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: He said, "Give me this ability too, so that anyone I place my hands on will receive the Holy Spirit."

verses.kjv: But Peter said unto him, Thy money perish with thee, because thou hast thought that the gift of God may be purchased with money.
verses.ct: But Peter told him, "May your money be destroyed along with you, because you thought you could buy God's gift with cash!"

verses.kjv: Thou hast neither part nor lot in this matter: for thy heart is not right in the sight of God.
verses.ct: "You have no share or role in this work, because your heart is not right before God."

verses.kjv: Repent therefore of this thy wickedness, and pray God, if perhaps the thought of thine heart may be forgiven thee.
verses.ct: "Turn away from this wickedness and pray to God — perhaps the intention of your heart can still be forgiven."

verses.kjv: For I perceive that thou art in the gall of bitterness, and in the bond of iniquity.
verses.ct: "I can see that you are full of bitter poison and trapped in sin."

verses.kjv: Then answered Simon, and said, Pray ye to the LORD for me, that none of these things which ye have spoken come upon me.
verses.ct: Simon responded, "Please pray to the Lord for me so that nothing you've described will happen to me!"

verses.kjv: And they, when they had testified and preached the word of the Lord, returned to Jerusalem, and preached the gospel in many villages of the Samaritans.
verses.ct: After Peter and John had shared their testimony and proclaimed the Lord's message, they headed back to Jerusalem, spreading the good news in many Samaritan villages along the way.

verses.kjv: And the angel of the Lord spake unto Philip, saying, Arise, and go toward the south unto the way that goeth down from Jerusalem unto Gaza, which is desert.
verses.ct: An angel of the Lord told Philip, "Get up and travel south along the desert road that runs from Jerusalem down to Gaza."

verses.kjv: And he arose and went: and, behold, a man of Ethiopia, an eunuch of great authority under Candace queen of the Ethiopians, who had the charge of all her treasure, and had come to Jerusalem for to worship,
verses.ct: So he got up and went. Along the way, he encountered an Ethiopian man — a court official with significant authority who served under Candace, the queen of Ethiopia, and managed all of her treasury. This man had traveled to Jerusalem to worship

verses.kjv: Was returning, and sitting in his chariot read Esaias the prophet.
verses.ct: and was now on his way home, sitting in his chariot and reading from the prophet Isaiah.

verses.kjv: Then the Spirit said unto Philip, Go near, and join thyself to this chariot.
verses.ct: The Spirit told Philip, "Go over and walk alongside that chariot."

verses.kjv: And Philip ran thither to him, and heard him read the prophet Esaias, and said, Understandest thou what thou readest?
verses.ct: Philip ran up to it and heard the man reading from the prophet Isaiah. He asked, "Do you understand what you're reading?"

verses.kjv: And he said, How can I, except some man should guide me? And he desired Philip that he would come up and sit with him.
verses.ct: The man replied, "How could I, unless someone explains it to me?" Then he invited Philip to climb up and sit beside him.

verses.kjv: The place of the scripture which he read was this, He was led as a sheep to the slaughter; and like a lamb dumb before his shearer, so opened he not his mouth:
verses.ct: The passage of Scripture he was reading was this: "He was led like a sheep to be slaughtered, and just as a lamb is silent before the one who shears it, he did not open his mouth."

verses.kjv: In his humiliation his judgment was taken away: and who shall declare his generation? for his life is taken from the earth.
verses.ct: "In his humiliation, justice was denied him. Who can speak of his descendants? For his life was cut short on the earth."

verses.kjv: And the eunuch answered Philip, and said, I pray thee, of whom speaketh the prophet this? of himself, or of some other man?
verses.ct: The official asked Philip, "Please tell me — who is the prophet talking about? Is he referring to himself, or to someone else?"

verses.kjv: Then Philip opened his mouth, and began at the same scripture, and preached unto him Jesus.
verses.ct: Starting from that very passage of Scripture, Philip began to explain and told him the good news about Jesus.

verses.kjv: And as they went on their way, they came unto a certain water: and the eunuch said, See, here is water; what doth hinder me to be baptized?
verses.ct: As they continued down the road, they came to a body of water. The official said, "Look — here's water! What's stopping me from being baptized?"

verses.kjv: And Philip said, If thou believest with all thine heart, thou mayest. And he answered and said, I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God.
verses.ct: Philip said, "If you believe with your whole heart, you can be." He answered, "I believe that Jesus Christ is the Son of God."

verses.kjv: And he commanded the chariot to stand still: and they went down both into the water, both Philip and the eunuch; and he baptized him.
verses.ct: He ordered the chariot to stop, and both Philip and the official went down into the water, where Philip baptized him.

verses.kjv: And when they were come up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord caught away Philip, that the eunuch saw him no more: and he went on his way rejoicing.
verses.ct: When they came up out of the water, the Spirit of the Lord suddenly took Philip away. The official never saw him again, but continued on his journey filled with joy.

verses.kjv: But Philip was found at Azotus: and passing through he preached in all the cities, till he came to Caesarea.
verses.ct: Philip, however, appeared at Azotus. He traveled through the area, proclaiming the good news in every town until he reached Caesarea.
